info.name: Globose nucleus
info.description: The globose nucleus is one of the deep nuclei of the cerebellum located between the fastigial and emboliform nuclei. In non-human species it is combined with the emboliform nucleus as a single nuclear mass and called the 'interposed' nucleus or 'nucleus interpositus'; this term is commonly used in human neuroanatomy as well. It receives input from the paravermal zone of cerebellar cortex and projects its output via the superior cerebellar peduncle to terminate in the ventral lateral nucleus of thalamus and the red nucleus.
